headline: Dave Ramsey Slams People Dreaming About The 1950s Ford Factory Worker Owning A Nice House, Says It Wasn't The Dream People Think It Was
summary: Personal finance expert Dave Ramsey has a message for people nostalgic about the “good old days” of American homeownership: you’re looking at the past through rose-colored glasses. That 1957 Dream Home Wasn’t What You Think In a recent episode of “The Ramsey Show,” Ramsey pushed back against a viral Instagram post that claimed a Ford Motor factory worker in the 1950s could afford a house, a car, and a stay-at-home wife on a single income. “I’m looking at the house. headline: Trump Wants to Cap Credit-Card Interest Rates. These Stocks Could Feel the Heat.
summary: President Donald Trump on Friday called for credit-card companies to cap the interest rates they charge customers, as the president leans harder into addressing consumers’ affordability concerns.  “Effective January 20, 2026, I, as President of the United States, am calling for a one year cap on Credit Card Interest Rates of 10%,” he said in a Truth Social post.  It was unclear how the move would be enacted, but credit-card companies may already be bracing for a negative stock reaction if a reduction in rates hits their net interest income.
